p: Pseudo R-squared values for the averaged models ranged from 0.55 to 0.57 ( S1 Table), while the null model (with only an autoregressive term and year dummy variable) had a pseudo R-squared value of 0.46. Prediction results for different model averages were consistent, so this discussion focuses on the model subset with coefficients significant at p < 0.05. LOO cross-validation prediction accuracy was typically higher for the weighted averaged models than the top AICc model but varied greatly depending on the omitted year ( S2 Table). Correlations between predicted number of cases of under-5 diarrhea and observed number of cases were very high for 2009 through 2017, but the 2008 correlation was very poor ( r = 0.1214). The averaged models containing environmental predictors performed much better overall in LOO cross-validation than the null model ( S4 Table).
